Incoming quality :
Inspection and ensuring of all electronic material, sheet metal material as
per technical specification inspection plans (Incoming quality plan) and 
sampling data plan. 
Ensure the specifications of all incoming components with respect to the 
specifications of customer circuit BOM.
TECHNICAL 
KNOWLEDGE
EXPERIENCE DETAILS: ( 2010 –
2016 )
SKILLS AND 
STRENGTHS
JOB DESCRIPTION

Created quality plans/ Inspection methods for new and existing 
parts/products to ensure compliance.
Circulate the Non conformance report and rejection report to the 
respective team on daily basis.
Analysis the rejections and take action for reduce rejection level.
Escalate the reports based on escalation matrix.
Raise SCAR for the rejection parts to supplier and follow the 
implementation from them.
Supplier performance monitoring along with consequent actions and 
corrective actions implementations.
Aware about 5S , IPC 600 H ( Bare PCB  Standard ) ,IPC 610 ( Assy PCB  
Standard ) ,ESD 
Prepare performance report, rejection trend and supplier rating for 
everymonth.
Prepare the process measure for non-conformance materials, rejection 
materials.  
Prepare schedule & follow onsite supplier Audit. 
Sample approval for custom made parts.
Regulatory complaints. Follow all the supplier and collet their REACH and 
RoHS certification data.
Maintaining the inspection/measuring equipment, calibration records and 
certificate traceability.
Create or change the inspection plan for custom made parts based on 
customer and CTQ requirement.
Monitor and improve the inspection method and time.
Working experience in advanced Quality tools like, APQP, PPAP, MSA, SPC
& FMEA.
Provide the Quality alert to incoming quality control based on repeated 
issues.
COMPANY NAME :  AARAA lightings Pvt Ltd.
DESIGNATION
     :  Incoming Quality & Warehouse Engineer
DEPARTMENT      :  Materials Management
EXPERIENCE         :  April 20’th 2016 TO Till Date.
EXPERIENCE DETAILS ( 2016 – 
2017 )
JOB DESCRIPTION

STORES - Roles and Responsibilities:

In charge for receipts, documentation, warehousing, inventory and stocking.

Receive incoming goods and supervise unloading of material Count.

Ensure that rules and regulations relating to customs and completed before receiving the
goods.

Check for hazardous / non-hazardous material, damage, discrepancy and arrange for 
inspection accordingly.

Prepare Goods Receipt Note (GRN) and Offer inspection to Quality with proper Tags and 
follow up for QC clearance.

QC accepted Goods are moved to stores location with proper Tags, in case of QC 
rejection Prepare Goods Rejection Memo (RTV).

Send other documents to respective department (ARE1, BOE, RGP)

Ensure all storage facilities are in proper working order e.g. check for loose racks, 
damaged pallets etc.

Ensure all materials handling equipment are in good condition, eg using vacuum pen for 
MSD components.

Ensure the manufacturer recommended shelf life and storage condition for every 
components/material. 

Ensure correct accounting of stores and Receipts and Issues are correctly documented 
(EIN/IDN/MRIN).

Coordinate with Purchasing Section on materials relating to purchases, inventory, and 
non-inventory items according to specifications and standards.

Based on production requirement, materials are issued with proper tags (Kitting) in FIFO
basis to production on timely basis to avoid line stoppage.

Proper validation are done while receiving the material from production, in specific the 
material loss ratio in production and reported circulated to related team.  

Safety stock are measured on weekly basis and report has been circulated to all divisions
for proper measures.
Declaration

I hereby declare that all the details furnished above are true to the best of
